item.title: Measuring the Adiabatic non-Hermitian Berry Phase in Feedback-Coupled Harmonic Oscillators
item.description:
For the first time since I began my PhD, I was able to spend more time traveling for conferences. In particular, I presented this poster at the Theory of Condensed Matter (TCM) Meeting, at the University of Warwick, then a few weeks later I took part to the conference on Condensed Matter and Quantum Materials (CMQM) organised by the Institute of Physics (IoP) at the University of Bath, and finally I have presented it at the University of Strathclyde, Glasgow, for the conference on Designing Out of Eequilibrium many-body Quantum systems (DesOEQ).
For more details about this work, take a look at the paper.

As it is a large file, it might take some time to download it - be patient :)

item.title: Grassmannization of the 3D Ising Model
item.description:
From 17th to 20th of September, right before I graduated my MSc, I had the chance to take part (and help managing, together with other MSc students) the 11th Italian Quantum Information Science Conference (IQIS) organised in Catania. Here I presented the work I had carried out during my Erasmus as part of Lode Pollet’s group. At the time I presented a different version of the poster. The one you find here is a “more standalone” version, that I presented at the Theory of Condensed Matter (TCM) Meeting, held in Warwick.
For more details about this work, take a look at the paper.

As it is a large file, it might take some time to download it - be patient :)
